fields.name: CHANNEL_INTERRUPT_ENABLE
fields.description: Per-channel interrupt enable bit

fields.name: ENABLE_CONTEXT_SWITCHING
fields.description: Enable automatic context switching for the channels

fields.name: ENABLE_CONTEXT_CACHING
fields.description: The software must set this bit to enable the caching of contexts between the operations

fields.name: GATHER_RESIDUAL_WRITES
fields.description: The software must set this bit to enable the ragged writes to the unaligned buffers to be gathered between multiple write operations

fields.name: PRESENT_SHA
fields.description: Indicates whether the SHA1/SHA2 functions are present.

fields.name: PRESENT_CRYPTO
fields.description: Indicates whether the crypto (cipher/hash) functions are present.

fields.name: CLKGATE
fields.description: This bit must be set to zero for a normal operation

fields.name: SFTRST
fields.description: Set this bit to zero to enable a normal DCP operation

fields.name: IRQ
fields.description: Indicates which channels have pending interrupt requests

fields.name: READY_CHANNELS
fields.description: Indicates which channels are ready to proceed with a transfer (the active channel is also included)

fields.name: CUR_CHANNEL
fields.description: Current (active) channel (encoded)

fields.name: OTP_KEY_READY
fields.description: When set, it indicates that the OTP key is shifted from the fuse block and is ready for use.

fields.name: IRQ
fields.description: Indicates which channels have pending interrupt requests

fields.name: READY_CHANNELS
fields.description: Indicates which channels are ready to proceed with a transfer (the active channel is also included)

fields.name: CUR_CHANNEL
fields.description: Current (active) channel (encoded)

fields.name: OTP_KEY_READY
fields.description: When set, it indicates that the OTP key is shifted from the fuse block and is ready for use.

fields.name: IRQ
fields.description: Indicates which channels have pending interrupt requests

fields.name: CUR_CHANNEL
fields.description: Current (active) channel (encoded)

fields.description: When set, it indicates that the OTP key is shifted from the fuse block and is ready for use.

fields.name: IRQ
fields.description: Indicates which channels have pending interrupt requests

fields.name: READY_CHANNELS
fields.description: Indicates which channels are ready to proceed with a transfer (the active channel is also included)

fields.name: CUR_CHANNEL
fields.description: Current (active) channel (encoded)

fields.name: OTP_KEY_READY
fields.description: When set, it indicates that the OTP key is shifted from the fuse block and is ready for use.

fields.name: ENABLE_CHANNEL
fields.description: Setting a bit in this field enables the DMA channel associated with it

fields.name: HIGH_PRIORITY_CHANNEL
fields.description: Setting a bit in this field causes the corresponding channel to have high-priority arbitration

fields.name: CH0_IRQ_MERGED
fields.description: Indicates that the interrupt for channel 0 must be merged with the other interrupts on the shared dcp_irq interrupt

fields.name: ENABLE_CHANNEL
fields.description: Setting a bit in this field enables the DMA channel associated with it

fields.name: HIGH_PRIORITY_CHANNEL
fields.description: Setting a bit in this field causes the corresponding channel to have high-priority arbitration

fields.name: CH0_IRQ_MERGED
fields.description: Indicates that the interrupt for channel 0 must be merged with the other interrupts on the shared dcp_irq interrupt

fields.name: ENABLE_CHANNEL
fields.description: Setting a bit in this field enables the DMA channel associated with it

fields.name: HIGH_PRIORITY_CHANNEL
fields.description: Setting a bit in this field causes the corresponding channel to have high-priority arbitration

fields.name: CH0_IRQ_MERGED
fields.description: Indicates that the interrupt for channel 0 must be merged with the other interrupts on the shared dcp_irq interrupt

fields.name: ENABLE_CHANNEL
fields.description: Setting a bit in this field enables the DMA channel associated with it

fields.name: HIGH_PRIORITY_CHANNEL
fields.description: Setting a bit in this field causes the corresponding channel to have high-priority arbitration

fields.name: CH0_IRQ_MERGED
fields.description: Indicates that the interrupt for channel 0 must be merged with the other interrupts on the shared dcp_irq interrupt

fields.name: NUM_KEYS
fields.description: Encoded value indicating the number of key-storage locations implemented in the design

fields.name: NUM_CHANNELS
fields.description: Encoded value indicating the number of channels implemented in the design

fields.name: DISABLE_UNIQUE_KEY
fields.description: Write to a 1 to disable the per-device unique key

fields.name: DISABLE_DECRYPT
fields.description: Write to 1 to disable the decryption

fields.name: CIPHER_ALGORITHMS
fields.description: One-hot field indicating which cipher algorithms are available

fields.name: HASH_ALGORITHMS
fields.description: One-hot field indicating which hashing features are implemented in the hardware

fields.name: ADDR
fields.description: Context pointer address

fields.name: SUBWORD
fields.description: Key subword pointer

fields.name: INDEX
fields.description: Key index pointer. The valid indices are 0-[number_keys].

fields.name: DATA
fields.description: Word 0 data for the key. This is the least-significant word.

fields.name: ADDR
fields.description: Next pointer register

fields.name: INTERRUPT
fields.description: Reflects whether the channel must issue an interrupt upon the completion of the packet.

fields.name: DECR_SEMAPHORE
fields.description: Reflects whether the channel's semaphore must be decremented at the end of the current operation

fields.name: CHAIN
fields.description: Reflects whether the next command pointer register must be loaded into the channel's current descriptor pointer

fields.name: CHAIN_CONTIGUOUS
fields.description: Reflects whether the next packet's address is located following this packet's payload.

fields.name: ENABLE_MEMCOPY
fields.description: Reflects whether the selected memory-copy (memcopy) function should be enabled for this operation.

fields.name: ENABLE_CIPHER
fields.description: Reflects whether the selected cipher function must be enabled for this operation.

fields.name: ENABLE_HASH
fields.description: Reflects whether the selected hashing function must be enabled for this operation.

fields.name: ENABLE_BLIT
fields.description: Reflects whether the DCP must perform a blit operation

fields.name: CIPHER_ENCRYPT
fields.description: When the cipher block is enabled, this bit indicates whether the operation is encryption or decryption

fields.name: CIPHER_INIT
fields.description: Reflects whether the cipher block must load the initialization vector from the payload for this operation

fields.name: OTP_KEY
fields.description: Reflects whether a hardware-based key must be used

fields.name: PAYLOAD_KEY
fields.description: When set, it indicates the payload contains the key

fields.name: HASH_INIT
fields.description: Reflects whether the current hashing block is the initial block in the hashing operation, so the hash registers must be initialized before the operation

fields.name: HASH_TERM
fields.description: Reflects whether the current hashing block is the final block in the hashing operation, so the hash padding must be applied by the hardware

fields.name: CHECK_HASH
fields.description: Reflects whether the calculated hash value must be compared to the hash provided in the payload.

fields.name: HASH_OUTPUT
fields.description: When the hashing is enabled, this bit controls whether the input or output data is hashed.

fields.name: CONSTANT_FILL
fields.description: When this bit is set (MEMCOPY and BLIT modes only), the DCP simply fills the destination buffer with the value found in the source address field

fields.name: TEST_SEMA_IRQ
fields.description: This bit is used to test the channel semaphore transition to 0. FOR TEST USE ONLY!

fields.name: KEY_BYTESWAP
fields.description: Reflects whether the DCP engine swaps the key bytes (big-endian key).

fields.name: KEY_WORDSWAP
fields.description: Reflects whether the DCP engine swaps the key words (big-endian key).

fields.name: INPUT_BYTESWAP
fields.description: Reflects whether the DCP engine byteswaps the input data (big-endian data).

fields.name: INPUT_WORDSWAP
fields.description: Reflects whether the DCP engine wordswaps the input data (big-endian data).

fields.name: OUTPUT_BYTESWAP
fields.description: Reflects whether the DCP engine byteswaps the output data (big-endian data).

fields.name: OUTPUT_WORDSWAP
fields.description: Reflects whether the DCP engine wordswaps the output data (big-endian data).

fields.name: TAG
fields.description: Packet Tag

fields.name: CIPHER_SELECT
fields.description: Cipher selection field

fields.name: CIPHER_MODE
fields.description: Cipher mode selection field. Reflects the mode of operation for the cipher operations.

fields.name: KEY_SELECT
fields.description: Key selection field

fields.name: HASH_SELECT
fields.description: Hash Selection Field

fields.name: CIPHER_CFG
fields.description: Cipher configuration bits. Optional configuration bits are required for the ciphers.

fields.name: ADDR
fields.description: Source buffer address pointer

fields.name: ADDR
fields.description: Destination buffer address pointer

fields.name: COUNT
fields.description: Byte count register. This value is the working value and updates as the operation proceeds.

fields.name: ADDR
fields.description: This regiser reflects the payload pointer for the current control packet.

registers.name: CH0CMDPTR
registers.description: DCP channel 0 command pointer address register

fields.name: ADDR
fields.description: Pointer to the descriptor structure to be processed for channel 0.

fields.name: INCREMENT
fields.description: The value written to this field is added to the semaphore count in an atomic way such that the simultaneous software adds and DCP hardware substracts happening on the same clock are protected

fields.name: VALUE
fields.description: This read-only field shows the current (instantaneous) value of the semaphore counter.

fields.name: HASH_MISMATCH
fields.description: This bit indicates that a hashing check operation mismatched for the control packets that enable the HASH_CHECK bit

fields.name: ERROR_SETUP
fields.description: This bit indicates that the hardware detected an invalid programming configuration (such as a buffer length that is not a multiple of the natural data size for the operation)

fields.name: ERROR_PACKET
fields.description: This bit indicates that a bus error occurred when reading the packet or payload, or when writing the status back to the packet payload

fields.name: ERROR_SRC
fields.description: This bit indicates that a bus error occurred when reading from the source buffer

fields.name: ERROR_DST
fields.description: This bit indicates that a bus error occurred when storing to the destination buffer

fields.name: ERROR_PAGEFAULT
fields.description: This bit indicates that a page fault occurred while converting a virtual address to a physical address

fields.name: ERROR_CODE
fields.description: Indicates the additional error codes for some of the error conditions

enumeratedValues.name: NEXT_CHAIN_IS_0
enumeratedValues.description: Error signalled because the next pointer is 0x00000000

enumeratedValues.name: NO_CHAIN
enumeratedValues.description: Error signalled because the semaphore is non-zero and neither chain bit is set

enumeratedValues.name: CONTEXT_ERROR
enumeratedValues.description: Error signalled because an error is reported reading/writing the context buffer

enumeratedValues.name: PAYLOAD_ERROR
enumeratedValues.description: Error signalled because an error is reported reading/writing the payload

enumeratedValues.name: INVALID_MODE
enumeratedValues.description: Error signalled because the control packet specifies an invalid mode select (for instance, blit + hash)

fields.name: TAG
fields.description: Indicates the tag from the last completed packet in the command structure

fields.description: This bit indicates that a hashing check operation mismatched for the control packets that enable the HASH_CHECK bit

fields.description: Pointer to the descriptor structure to be processed for channel 1.

fields.name: ERROR_SETUP

enumeratedValues.name: NEXT_CHAIN_IS_0
enumeratedValues.description: Error is signalled because the next pointer is 0x00000000.

enumeratedValues.name: NO_CHAIN
enumeratedValues.description: Error is signalled because the semaphore is of a non-zero value and neither of the chain bits is set.

enumeratedValues.name: CONTEXT_ERROR
enumeratedValues.description: Error is signalled because an error was reported when reading/writing the context buffer.

enumeratedValues.name: PAYLOAD_ERROR
enumeratedValues.description: Error is signalled because an error was reported when reading/writing the payload.

enumeratedValues.name: INVALID_MODE
enumeratedValues.description: Error is signalled because the control packet specifies an invalid mode select (for example, blit + hash).

enumeratedValues.name: CONTEXT_ERROR
enumeratedValues.description: Error is signalled because an error was reported while reading/writing the context buffer.

enumeratedValues.name: PAYLOAD_ERROR
enumeratedValues.description: Error is signalled because an error was reported while reading/writing the payload.

enumeratedValues.name: INVALID_MODE
enumeratedValues.description: Error is signalled because the control packet specifies an invalid mode select (for instance, blit + hash).

fields.name: TAG
fields.description: Indicates the tag from the last completed packet in the command structure.

fields.name: HASH_MISMATCH
fields.description: This bit indicates that a hashing check operation is mismatched for the control packets that enable the HASH_CHECK bit

fields.name: ERROR_SETUP
fields.description: This bit indicates that the hardware detected an invalid programming configuration (such as a buffer length that is not a multiple of the natural data size for the operation)

fields.name: ERROR_PACKET
fields.description: This bit indicates that a bus error occurred when reading the packet or payload, or when writing the status back to the packet paylaod

fields.name: ERROR_SRC
fields.description: This bit indicates that a bus error occurred when reading from the source buffer

fields.name: ERROR_DST
fields.description: This bit indicates that a bus error occurred when storing to the destination buffer

fields.name: ERROR_PAGEFAULT
fields.description: This bit indicates that a page fault occurred while converting a virtual address to a physical address

fields.name: ERROR_CODE
fields.description: Indicates additional error codes for some of the error conditions.

enumeratedValues.name: NEXT_CHAIN_IS_0
enumeratedValues.description: Error is signalled because the next pointer is 0x00000000.

enumeratedValues.name: NO_CHAIN
enumeratedValues.description: Error is signalled because the semaphore is of a non-zero value and neither of the chain bits is set.

enumeratedValues.name: CONTEXT_ERROR
enumeratedValues.description: Error is signalled because an error was reported while reading/writing the context buffer.

enumeratedValues.name: PAYLOAD_ERROR
enumeratedValues.description: Error is signalled because an error was reported while reading/writing the payload.

enumeratedValues.name: INVALID_MODE
enumeratedValues.description: Error is signalled because the control packet specifies an invalid mode select (for instance, blit + hash).

registers.name: CH3CMDPTR
registers.description: DCP channel 3 command pointer address register

fields.name: ADDR
fields.description: Pointer to the descriptor structure to be processed for channel 3.

fields.name: INCREMENT
fields.description: The value written to this field is added to the semaphore count in an atomic way, such that the simultaneous software adds and DCP hardware substracts happening on the same clock are protected

fields.name: VALUE
fields.description: This read-only field shows the current (instantaneous) value of the semaphore counter.

fields.name: INDEX
fields.description: Selects a value to read via the debug data register.

fields.name: DATA
fields.description: Debug data

fields.name: ENABLE
fields.description: Page table enable control

fields.name: FLUSH
fields.description: Page table flush control. To flush the TLB, write this bit to 1 and then back to 0.

fields.name: BASE
fields.description: Page table base address

fields.name: STEP
fields.description: Fixed read-only value reflecting the stepping of the version of the design implementation.

fields.name: MINOR
fields.description: Fixed read-only value reflecting the MINOR version of the design implementation.

fields.name: MAJOR
fields.description: Fixed read-only value reflecting the MAJOR version of the design implementation.
